item.title: Standing lamp on Truman’s Road, 29th August
item.description:
Toward the turning of Truman’s Road and Pellerin Road there is a standard lamp which is on the ground and the bulb is broken. Shattered glass on the ground. Thanks for the other things you cleared from the road earlier this week.

item.title: Two 'We are family' music gig plastic banners affixed to the attractive park railings by the grand park gates and listed park keeper's house, Beckenham Rec (aka Croydon Rd Rec)., 29th August
item.description:
Two 'We are family' music gig plastic banners affixed to the attractive park railings by the grand park gates and listed park keeper's house, Beckenham Rec (aka Croydon Rd Rec). I disagree with turning the railings into a linear advertisement hoarding, however Bromley Council has permitted a park event advert then one will do.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 319, Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Park name board removed and scruffy board visible, Croydon Rd Rec, Beckenham, 29th August
item.description:
Park name board removed and an even older scruffy sign left visible. Please remove. This makes a poor impression on entering the lovely park. The Listed Park Keeper's House and the newly refurbished Edwardian Banstand are nearby. There are many tacky plastic advertisement banners cable-tied to the attractive park railings spoiling the green frontage and setting of the double gates and park keeper's cottage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 319, Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Montague Place, 29th August
item.description:
The street nameplate on the corner of Montague Place, next to the junction with Gower Street - the red W1 letters are peeling off. Can the street nameplate here be replaced please ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Bedford Square, Bloomsbury, London
